citation.article-title: Lactobacillus algidus sp. nov., a psychrophilic lactic acid bacterium isolated from vacuum-packaged refrigerated beef.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus algidus sp. nov.
Lactobacillus algidus (al'gi.dus. L. adj. algidus cold, referring to the ability to grow at low temperature)
Cells are facultatively anaerobic, non-spore-forming, Gram-positive, non-motile rods.
Colonies are circular, convex, smooth, cream-white and 1.0-1.5 mm in diameter after 48 h incubation at 20 °C on MRS agar.
The cellular morphology depends on growth medium: coccobacilli or short rods in MRS broth and rods (0.3-0.7x1.1-1.9 μm) on MRS agar.
Growth occurs at 0-25 °C.
No growth at 30 °C.
Catalase and oxidase are not produced.
Aesculin is hydrolysed.
Hydrogen sulfide is not produced.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Gelatin is not liquefied.
No dextran is produced from sucrose.
Acid is produced from N-acetyl D-glucosamine, L-arabinose, arbutin, D-fructose, galactose, D-glucose, D-mannose, ribose, salicin and trehalose.

Acid is not produced from adonitol, D-arabinose, glycerin, glycogen, inulin, mannitol, melezitose, α-methyl D-glycoside, α-methyl D-mannoside, rhamnose, sorbitol, L-sorbose, starch, D-tagatose, D-turanose, xylitol or L-xylose.
Most strains produce acid from aesculin and melibiose.
Some strains produce acid from cellobiose, lactose, maltose and D-xylose.
Most strains do not produce acid from amygdalin, D-raffinose or sucrose (Table 2).
The major cellular fatty acids produced by strain M6A9T are the straight-chain mono-unsaturated oleic acid [C18:1(Δ9)] and straight-chain saturated palmitic acid (C16:0).
G­+C contents of DNA of strains M6A9T (=JCM 10491T), M6A19 (=JCM 10492) and M6A40 (=JCM 10493) are 36.5, 37.1 and 36.4 mol%, respectively, as determined by the HPLC method.
The type strain is M6A9T (=JCM 10491T).

The description of the type strain corresponds to that of the species except that acid is produced from cellobiose, aesculin, lactose and D-xylose, whereas no acid is produced from amygdalin, maltose, melibiose, raffinose or sucrose.
The peptidoglycan type is mDAP.
Habitat: vacuum-packaged refrigerated beef stored at low temperatures.
